metadata.title: CVE-2012-1584 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the mid function in toolkit/tbytevector.cpp in TagLib1.7 and earlier allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (application crash) via a crafted file header field in a mediafile, which triggers a large memory allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtag1v5 - 1.7.1-3
libtag1v5-vanilla - 1.7.1-3
libtagc0 - 1.7.1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: taglib package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.1-3').
